result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  demand for speedy trial.  (Jaruthh M. Gathings - #2022003901, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in court, in custody. Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court with Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings. Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan for Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is currently in custody on an 18 month revocation.  Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial.  

Defense anticipates filing motions, but is waiting for forensic evidence from State.  State is waiting for the report from the DNA analysis.  The reports needs to be submitted by October 31st.  Motions to be filed by November 18, 2022.

No Miranda Goodchild issues at this time.

Defense has mailed client a USB stick, but is informed the jail has not provided the defendant with access to the discovery materials, assuming it was lost.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court, defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant's appearance waived.  Revocation proceedings are ongoing.  Discovery has been provided.   The judge has signed an order allowing the defendant to view a virtual copy of the discovery while in jail.  Due to late receipt of the order, the defendant has just received the disc.  Defense request an adjournment and place reasons on the record.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Permitting Review of Digital Discovery at Milwaukee County Jail, signed and filed.

Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton in court, defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant's previous filed motion from 5-5-2022 was withdrawn at prelim hearing. Defense requesting video viewing order. State does not object. Court grants. Case adjourned in Branch 15.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in court with Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton; both appear by video.  Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Tramel-McClain. Exhibits 1 & 2 offered by the State and received by the Court. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Exhibits 1 & 2 are withdrawn. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based on defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Jay Fenton as counsel for defendant.  Attorney Fenton accepts the appointment.  Order signed and filed.

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings appeared by video means with Attorney.  Attorney Jaymes Fenton appeared via video as a friend of the court.  Case in court for hearing pursuant to State v. Lee.  Court is advised that the Office of the State Public Defender has not appointed counsel as set forth in the record.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Jaruthh Gathings - #2022003901, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaruthh Marsceedashon Gathings appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied by the court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
